meanings.definition: The lower edge or rim of a hat.
meanings.sent1: She adjusted her hat's underbrim to shield her eyes from the sun.
meanings.sent2: The underbrim of his cap was frayed from constant use.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid an acorn under the underbrim of the gardener's hat.
meanings.sent4: His smile peeked out from under the underbrim of his cowboy hat.
meanings.sent5: The underbrim of the umbrella provided a welcome shade on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To be located beneath the brim of a hat.
meanings.sent1: The cat liked to nap underbrim of the straw hat on the porch.
meanings.sent2: The flower tucked underbrim of the wide-brimmed hat looked lovely.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to sneak underbrim of every hat in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed underbrim of the oversized sun hat.
meanings.sent5: The secret note was hidden underbrim of the detective's fedora.
